text: Advanced Air Mobility has the potential to revolutionize personal transportation, but only if gov't can create a regulatory climate that enables its growth. I'm happy to see two bills pass to forward that goal - a meaningful first step for this incredibly exciting new industry. https://t.co/qupdqXCofM

I enjoyed meeting with students from @RimoftheWorld  yesterday during their visit to Washington, D.C. The students and families were able to tour the Capitol Building and ask questions about my work in Congress representing #CA08. https://t.co/TnIBvKWV9e

On this day in 1777, the United States flag was officially adopted by a resolution of the Second Continental Congress. May our flag always stand resolute as a symbol of the unity of our nation and of our hard won liberty and freedom. https://t.co/T4sgynzFhq

Happy 247 birthday to the @usarmy! Thank you in particular all our Army servicemembers and veterans currently serving and living in the High Desert, Inland Empire and Eastern Sierra. Today and every day we honor these heroes for their service to our country. https://t.co/aYaYeXUS9L

According to the JEC, inflation is now costing the average CA household $8,425 a year. Economists tell us out-of-control government spending is the main cause. We must take immediate steps to end deficit spending & stop the harm it is doing to families. https://t.co/ph8xLqlnFw

The cost of energy increased 34.6% and groceries 11.9%. Sadly, these figures are only projected to worsen this summer.

Economists have pointed to last year's record spending as a leading cause for why the US is experiencing this level of inflation while other countries are not.
We must reverse the bad policies that have led us to this point, put our federal budget on a path towards balance, and get our economy back on track.

The Department of Labor released new inflation numbers that unfortunately herald more bad news for American families. The data shows that inflation last month reached 8.6%, its highest level in more than four decades. https://t.co/5Kxzf6Uyd9

The role of woman in our armed forces is dramatically different than it was even a generation ago, and  it is critical that VA care changes accordingly. I was proud to support two bills recently to improve screenings for women vets, especially those exposed to toxic substances.

I recently joined @Newsmax to talk about a number of hot-button issues, including the crisis on the southern border and the gun control negotiations being held in Congress. Watch the full interview here: https://t.co/kqTzrIyzOd

Inflation cost the average worker nearly two paychecks last year, nearly $5,000 for the average American family. As inflation and gas prices continue to increase, that impact will be even higher in 2022. Inflation is a tax on all Americans, and it is one we shouldn’t have to pay.

I’m proud that the Patient Advocate Tracker Act which I coauthored passed the House. This bill will increase transparency at VA by creating an electronic system for veterans to submit & track complaints about care. This is big a step towards improved health outcomes for our vets.

Gas prices continue to break records this week, and the prices in our district are some of the highest in the country. The answer to this problem is expanding domestic production and returning America to energy independence.

America’s high energy prices are hurting workers and families across the country. I was proud to join @RepGarretGraves @RepHerrell and @RepFeenstra today in fighting to unleash American energy innovation, which can both lower prices and make our planet cleaner. https://t.co/ObCmMVcv8n

Yesterday at the border, CBP agents showed us serious shortcomings in the tools at their disposal to secure our southern boundary. They need better tools, funding and support if we hope to stop the flow of illegal drugs and human trafficking into our community. https://t.co/3pK6l7mNit

Sections of border wall that never went up as a result of the new administration’s policies are rusting away while border crossings rise and physical security measures are reduced. Regardless of one’s stance on the border, we can all agree this is an egregious waste of resources. https://t.co/JTr9G3YQ72

I’m in McAllen, TX with @housebudgetgop at the busiest section for migrant crossings on our southern border. We received a briefing from CBP this morning that made it abundantly clear urgent action is needed to deter crossings & give our officers tools they need. More to come… https://t.co/BsztmF2W8n

I was honored to join the Big Bear community today to memorialize those who gave their lives in defense of our great nation. Thank you to everyone who helped us remember the fallen and honor their sacrifice. https://t.co/RzCl5oTISf

Heather and I are praying for the town of Uvalde and the families of the young people lost to senseless violence yesterday. As parents, we can only imagine the grief these families are feeling. Our hearts go out to those affected by this horrific tragedy.

I'm proud to announce this year's #CA08 Congressional Art Competition winner is Raquel (grade 12) for "Heartless," followed by Jenny (grade 11) and Johanna (grade 12). Congratulations to all three of you on your hard work & artistic prowess! https://t.co/sd3JXdMhP4 https://t.co/SJ7oJIEQUx

Ultimately, however, it is critical that we stabilize our economy & lower inflation if we hope to end the ongoing supply chain crisis. I am continuing the fight by pushing back against irresponsible gov't spending & fighting to keep dollars in the hands of the American taxpayers.

This week, I cosponsored H.R. 7718, the Formula Act, to direct the FDA to agree to an international standard for infant formula to speed importations & voted in support of H.R. 7791, the Access to Baby Formula Act, to help protect WIC participants from future supply disruptions.

The baby formula shortage is a serious crisis for families here in #CA08 & across the nation. Unfortunately, the failure of the federal government to proactively address the supply shortage after closing the Abbot plant means it may now take months for supplies to reach shelves.

An all-of-the-above approach to expanded American domestic energy production will lower global emissions, capitalize on American innovation to create jobs, lower prices, and export our energy and technology to the world. Learn how here: https://t.co/iqZIRl9SBM

US military systems are under constant threat from our adversaries. There is a global race to perfect and deploy AI in the warfighting arena, and we must ensure our military has the best possible AI capabilities to defend against those who would seek to do our nation harm.

I am proud to introduce the AI for National Security Act alongside @RepJimmyPanetta to ensure DOD is able to leverage AI cybersecurity applications to give our nation’s defenders the best tools possible to prevent and defeat cyber-attacks. https://t.co/qXvAnqIOeF

California experiences both wet & dry years. We must address our serious shortage of water storage with legislation such as the WOW Act & Emergency Drought Relief Act that I’ve cosponsored to build our water reserves in the wet years & ensure adequate supplies in the dry years.

More than half of the country's fruits, nuts, and vegetables are grown here in California. That production can't occur without reliable water, and the prices we pay for these vital foods will increase even further as supplies diminish.

Communities across the country will feel the effects of California's poor planning in water storage this summer with potential shortages of fruits, vegetables and nuts brought on by California's drought conditions and the global supply chain crisis.

The Administration's cancelation of oil & gas lease sales is another major misstep as Americans face record-high gas prices. We must return America to energy independence & stop the disastrous impacts that these high energy prices have on working families. https://t.co/8HwRcVzLjh

I joined @SheriffDicus & @SBCountySheriff Honor Guard to commemorate fallen law enforcement officers, including Sgt. Dominic Vaca, in our nation's capital this weekend. Thank you to these outstanding individuals & all who put their lives on the line to keep our community safe. https://t.co/GXsubujtN6

May 15 is National Peace Officer Memorial Day, where we honor law enforcement officers who lost their lives in the line of duty. Sadly, @SBCountySheriff Sgt. Dominic Vaca's name is newly carved on the Washington, D.C. memorial. He will be particularly remembered this year. https://t.co/PYsQBkuX7Y

I was live on @MottekonMoney on Tuesday night to discuss rising gas prices and the devastating impact they are having on our community. If you missed the interview, you can catch it here: https://t.co/FPfVX8j08H

A bill before @NatResources this week would "conserve" national forests by limiting roads. Unfortunately, this would both increase fires & limit firefighting. Approx. 1/3 of roadless Natl Forest areas burned in the last 3 decades, while less than 1/5 of roaded areas have.

Regulations, taxes & fees have resulted in CA gas prices roughly $1 higher than natl average. In addition, our home energy costs are some of the highest, yet our grid is unreliable. Our nation needs energy independence, not policies that have failed in CA. https://t.co/O8ARou3Reu

As events begin in our nation’s Capital today in commemoration of National Police Week, please join me in taking a moment to recognize our law enforcement and the vital work they do to protect our families and our community. https://t.co/VHkqeZBEXA

Today’s CPI report shows that not only did high inflation continue to increase consumer prices last month, but the core price index (which excludes food & fuel costs) accelerated alarmingly as increased costs for raw materials were passed on to consumers. https://t.co/jz4QlgYMsP

Prices are up in nearly every sector over the past year including:

Gas Utilities: +22.7%
Electricity: +11.0%
Apparel: +5.4%
Shelter: +5.1%
Used Cars: +22.7%
Meats/Fish/Eggs: +14.3%
Food at home: +10.8%
Food away from home: +7.2%

These prices are hurting families in #CA08 & across the country. It is imperative that action be taken immediately to reverse the disastrous policies that led us to this point. We should start by eliminating deficit spending causing this inflation & balancing our federal budget.

Recent info that a Big Tech-affiliated organization was paying staff salaries at the WH is deeply troubling. I've joined @RepJamesComer @RepFrankLucas @RepRalphNorman to fulfil Congress' fundamental watchdog responsibility in investigating this conduct. https://t.co/NTNOlmhL39

CA’s over-regulation of the energy industry has resulted in the state forecasting a 1,700 megawatt power shortage this summer. 3.75 mil homes could be w/o power when demand peaks. Govt has caused this problem & govt must restore reliability to our grid. https://t.co/vsxQnYKpUg

Last spring gas prices made headlines when they reached $2.71. With today’s new nat'l average of $4.20 (and $5.76 in SB County!) last year’s price ironically seems like a great deal. It's time we fix rising gas prices & end the heavy burden on CA families. https://t.co/O8ARou3Reu

We are still facing record-high gas prices across our country, and every day I hear from people here in #CA08 about the financial toll these prices are taking. I took a closer look at this issue in a new op-ed to the @sbsun. Read the article here:

Gas prices are the most expensive they have been in our history, and CA's prices are already significantly higher than the national average. Californians can't afford to pay an even higher gas tax, and our state government shouldn't ask them to.

Inflation continues to levy a heavy tax on the Americans who can least afford it, with 64% of Americans now living paycheck to paycheck. Economists say that irresponsible federal spending is what’s caused this problem. We need to stop government over-spending, not add to it.

The increasing impact of catastrophic wildfires is putting some of our most treasured species and natural lands at risk. It is also harming our towns & tourism. Better forest management practices are proven to help reduce wildfires, and they need to be implemented in California.

The report also concludes “the negative effects of delaying the implementation of policy changes… would be disproportionately borne by younger people & lower-income people.” We must act now to rein in deficit spending & stabilize our debt!  Full report: https://t.co/goKVADUf1z

The report finds that “the high & rising federal debt that CBO projects over the next 3 decades would have serious consequences for the economy & federal budget, including the crowding out of private investment, higher interest costs, and increased risks of a fiscal crisis."
On Thursday, @USCBO released a shocking new report studying the catastrophic consequences of our out-of-control national debt. (thread)

Saturday is National Drug Take Back Day! Help prevent medication misuse & opioid addiction by removing unneeded & expired medications from your home and safely disposing of them at one of several take-back sites in our district. Find a site near you here: https://t.co/SPgH1hnKru

The death of a Texas National Guardsman at our Southern border is tragic and sadly indicative of how extreme the crisis at the border has become. Migrant encounters are up a staggering 542% from March 2020, making for the worst months at our border in over two decades.

Unfortunately, this crisis doesn't stop at the border. #CA08 continues to experience a severe rise in fentanyl deaths caused by drugs crossing the border, as well as community intimidation and violence from cartel-run, human-trafficking fueled illegal marijuana grows.

California and our nation cannot afford to allow this border crisis to continue. We must support our border patrol agents, increase physical security at the border, and stop the flow of drug and human trafficking into our communities.
This #HolocaustRemembranceDay, or Yom Hashoah marks the 78th anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising. May we never forget the millions of lives lost and the stories of all who suffered. #NeverAgain

If we want to expand the use of electric vehicles & green energy in the next decade, then we MUST increase our domestic critical mineral supply to support that goal. We cannot rely on imports from nations like China.

America produces some of the cleanest energy in the world, & techniques pioneered here make us better stewards of the Earth. It is critical that we increase domestic energy & critical mineral production now to both bring prices back down & make our planet a cleaner place.

The average gas price in SB County is $5.96 today. Unfortunately, the Admin's FY23 budget would increase prices even more through further targeting of domestic oil & gas production. This would be a disaster for the thousands in #CA08 who commute to work to feed their families.

Even with an additional $58 trillion in new taxes, America’s debt will continue to grow under President Biden's proposed budget to over $45 trillion by 2032 – a $15 trillion increase from today. This would be the unfortunate result of a decade of unchecked government spending.

During my Q&A w/ OMB Dir. Young at yesterday’s Budget hearing, it was clear Pres. Biden's FY23 budget was created under the belief that a large national debt does not harm the American economy. I vehemently disagree & I believe the many Americans suffering from inflation do too. https://t.co/UwdYGFceIW
American families cannot afford more federal government spending and higher inflation. This budget doubles down on policies that have resulted in the inflation crisis we are currently facing.

Over the next 10 years, this FY23 budget would grow govt spending by $8 trillion more than predicted by the CBO. This means inflation will also increase beyond predictions, which, coupled with interest rate increases, would further increase the deficit by trillions of dollars.

American families are currently losing $3,500 each year to inflation. This “inflation tax” will be paired with an additional $58 trillion in actual taxes under the President’s budget, including a nearly $1T tax increase on families.

Over the past few days, the White House has claimed that President Biden’s FY23 Budget will result in a $1.3 trillion lower deficit than last year. Let’s take a moment to unpack that number. (THREAD) #BidenBudget

Last year, the federal govt added $2.39T of spending to the national debt through major social bills that have led to devastating inflation. Reducing spending by $1.3T would still represent a more than $1T INCREASE over spending levels under the previous administration.

I spoke with #CA08 senior citizens this week regarding the Medicare Advantage program & improving access to care in our rural district. We need more doctors and higher Medicare reimbursement rates to ensure our residents have access to the care they need.

Changing our clocks twice a year is outdated & hazardous to our heath & safety. I pushed forward legislation on this issue in the State Assembly & I am a proud cosponsor of the Sunshine Protection Act that passed the Senate unanimously. It's time for this practice to end.

The JUSTICE Act incentivizes trainings to reduce use of force, ends the use of choke holds, and promotes transparency by enhancing the use of body cameras. It’s time America works to support and improve our law enforcement agencies - not defund them.
We are a nation based on the rule of law - defunding our police is not a viable option, and stripping them of their ability to operate is a dangerous path to go down.
We saw an unprecedented spike in murders in 2020, particularly in places where there were efforts to undermine our law enforcement officers or defund their agencies.

THREAD: We all agree that our justice system needs common sense reforms.  Unfortunately the Justice in Policing Act we voted on in the House today would make it nearly impossible for law enforcement officers to do their jobs and keep our communities safe.

This bill eliminates qualified immunity which protects law enforcement personnel from frivolous lawsuits unless they violate a person’s rights or break the law. Our police need to know they can take proper & necessary actions w/o fear of being sued for simply doing their jobs.
I've cosponsored a common-sense alternative to this bill called the JUSTICE Act which implements many of the same provisions while still protecting our law enforcement personnel.
